title: Gorjovak
body: It is governed from the ancient fortress of Gor'kul. It contains many settlements set amongst its mountains.
preface: Gorjovak is a mountainous region in the North-West of the Inditt Region.

title: Gorjovak
body:
Governance

Cazar

The Cazar governs the realm of Gorjovak from within the ancient fortress of Gor'kul.




The People of Gorjovak

               Gorjovakians are a proud people who tend to be hostile to outside cultural influence. The cooler temperatures gives them paler skin, and so they can find it difficult to acclimatise to warmer sea-level temperatures. They are known for their jet-black hair (Heru is of Gorjovakian heritage) and green eyes.

               They wear heavy linen garments, more akin to medieval tunics than the lightweight cloth tunics found in the desert towns, and are typically a deep red or purple in colour.

               A specially bred sub-species of Neguit is the most common creature found in the lands. It is bred for its copious amount of wool that can be harvested in its autumn coat, producing plenty of insulation and thick threads for the winter to come. During the winter, most of the livestock are slaughtered for meat to last through the hard seasons. Only the best of the livestock survive and live inside houses and halls in order to create the next moons line of livestock.
preface: Gorjovak is a mountainous region in the North-West of the Inditt Region. It contains many settlements set amongst its mountains.

title: Gorjovak
body:
Governance

Cazar

The Cazar governs the realm of Gorjovak from within the ancient fortress of Gor'kul


Culture

People

The Gorjan people are a proud culture who tend to be hostile to outside cultural influence. The cooler temperatures gives them paler skin, and so they can find it difficult to acclimatise to warmer sea-level temperatures. They are known for thick brown hair and green eyes.

Clothing              

They wear heavy linen garments, more akin to medieval tunics than the lightweight cloth tunics found in the desert towns, and are typically a deep red or purple in colour.

Agriculture

A specially bred sub-species of Neguit is the most common creature found in the lands. It is bred for its copious amount of wool that can be harvested in its autumn coat, producing plenty of insulation and thick threads for the winter to come. During the winter, most of the livestock are slaughtered for meat to last through the hard seasons. Only the best of the livestock survive and live inside houses and halls in order to create the next moons line of livestock.

Military

Their uniforms are either red or purple tunics. The tunics are thread with a thin metal weave that creates a lightweight armour that can withstand sword and axe. Typical weapons are hammers due to their dual use as a tool, and spears, which are often used for their light weight and ease to carry whist traversing the mountain ranges. They also proficient archers.

Temple

 The first recorded Ren-Sumbi was Hakk Muttas, who is recorded only by ancient tapestries in the Gorjon Archives. The Ren-Luzzo of the Gorjon Temple is Barbaska Neet.
preface: Gorjovak is a mountainous region in the North-West of the Inditt Region. It contains many settlements set amongst its mountains.

preface: Gorjovak is a mountainous region in the North-West of the Inditt Region. It contains many settlements set amongst its mountains.

title: Gorjovak
body:
Governance

Cazar

The Cazar governs the realm of Gorjovak from within the ancient fortress of Gor'kul. Grjovak is the only surviving monarchy in the Inditt Region, and it is said (but not confirmed) that the line of the monarchy descends from Mant Tummo. 

Culture

Gorjovak is famed for many things, but most of all their stonework. Their houses, and even the fortress of Gor’kul, is built from the mountain’s stone, and their masonry is far superior to any other in the Inditt Region. The Kingdom has amassed substantial wealth due to its unique resources and intricate masonry and metalwork exports.

People

The Gorjan people are a proud culture who tend to be hostile to outside cultural influence. The cooler temperatures gives them paler skin, and so they can find it difficult to acclimatise to warmer sea-level temperatures. They are known for thick brown hair and green eyes.

Clothing              

They wear heavy linen garments, more akin to medieval tunics than the lightweight cloth tunics found in the desert towns, and are typically a deep red or purple in colour.

Agriculture

The ground of Gorjovak is relatively fertile, for it contains nutritional remainders from the mountain’s volcanic history. However, the cold climate makes agriculture a constant battle. This has led to the hardy nature of the Gorjon people. 

A specially bred sub-species of Neguit is the most common creature found in the lands. It is bred for its copious amount of wool that can be harvested in its autumn coat, producing plenty of insulation and thick threads for the winter to come. During the winter, most of the livestock are slaughtered for meat to last through the hard seasons. Only the best of the livestock survive and live inside houses and halls in order to create the next moons line of livestock.

Military

Their uniforms are either red or purple tunics. The tunics are thread with a thin metal weave that creates a lightweight armour that can withstand sword and axe. Typical weapons are hammers due to their dual use as a tool, and spears, which are often used for their light weight and ease to carry whist traversing the mountain ranges. They also proficient archers.

Temple

 The first recorded Ren-Sumbi was Hakk Muttas, who is recorded only by ancient tapestries in the Gorjon Archives. The Ren-Luzzo of the Gorjon Temple is Barbaska Neet.

Geography

Due to its elevation, Gorjovak experiences a perpetually cooler climate, although winter seasons are especially cold. At the base of the mountain range is the remainder of the Forest of Kunnbar, now named the Forest of Handunn.

Its climate has given rise to many regional variations of common animals, such as the Gorjon Neguit, which grows exceptional thick wool, and also unique fauna and flora.

Its climate has given rise to many regional variations of common animals, such as the Gorjon Neguit, which grows exceptional thick wool, and also unique fauna and flora.
preface: Gorjovak is a mountainous region in the North-West of the Inditt Region. It contains many settlements set amongst its mountains. The name Gorjovak refers to both its location and the kingdom under which it is ruled. It is the longest last nation in the Inditt Region.

title: Gorjovak
body:
History

Age of Races

Vant Gorjosofor is the oldest recorded Cazar (King) of Gorjovak. It is believed that either his family name gave the name to the region, or that his family name was inspired by the region. Vant Gorjosofar's eldest son Turu Gorjosofar became Mant Tummo in the Age of the First Men. In the oldest written histories documenting the Gorjosofar family it is said that the Gorjosofar line had already ruled Gorjovak since mankind was born, meaning that their dynasty had already lasted for 2000 moons, although this cannot be proven.

Age of the First Men

When Turu Gorjosofar rose to power, his father Vant Gorjosofar had already died, and Turu was already Cazar. However, he chose to adopt the new title of Mant to signify his greater power. He ordered for the construction of the fortress of Gor'kul, which still stands and has never once been breached in its entire history.

Age of Uncertainty

When Turu died, the contest for rulership began. The name of Gorjovak's next ruler is known only as "Horrum", and is thought to have been Turu's cousin on his Mother's side. Horrum readopted the title of Cazar, wishing not to be associated with the overthrown First Men, and thus the title remained throughout history. During the remainder of the age, Gorjovak stood as one of the few areas of stability due to its isolation. Whilst the Gorjon people have always been self-relient, the chaos of the Inditt Region cemented this mindset.

Geography

Location

Gorjovak is located in the far North-West of the Inditt Region. The kingdom's territory stretches further than the Mountains of Gorjovak, reaching slightly further South and East. At the base of the mountain range is the remainder of the Forest of Kunnbar, now named the Forest of Handunn.

Climate

Due to its elevation, Gorjovak experiences a perpetually colder climate, although winter seasons are especially cold and snow and ice become all-consuming.

Its climate has given rise to many regional variations of common animals, such as the Gorjon Neguit, which grows exceptional thick wool, and also unique fauna and flora. 

Governance

Cazar

A Cazar governs the realm of Gorjovak from within the ancient fortress of Gor'kul. Gorjovak is the only surviving monarchy in the Inditt Region, and it is said (but not confirmed) that the line of the monarchy descends from Mant Tummo. The title of Cazar is usually passed to the Cazar's eldest child upon their death. A Cazar is sworn to serve the realm their entire life, and as such one may never abdicate.

Architecture

Most buildings are made using the plentiful supply of hard mountain stone, with tumber being used from the Forest of Handunn to provide roofing and outhouses. Watchtowers litter the mountain range, as well as a multitude of safe-houses for scouts and travellers alike to find refuge during adverse weather conditions.

There are no cities in Gorjovak. Whilst Gor'kul can house up to 5,000 men, the largest settlement is Dieradorr in the Eastern parts of the range, which has a population of about 30,000.

Culture

People

The Gorjan people are a proud culture who tend to be hostile to outside cultural influence. The cooler temperatures gives them paler skin, and so they can find it difficult to acclimatise to warmer sea-level temperatures. They are known for thick brown hair and green eyes.

Clothing              

They wear heavy linen garments, more akin to medieval tunics than the lightweight cloth tunics found in the desert towns, and are typically a deep red or purple in colour.

Economy

Agriculture

The ground of Gorjovak is relatively fertile, for it contains nutritional remainders from the mountain’s volcanic history. However, the cold climate makes agriculture a constant battle. This has led to the hardy nature of the Gorjon people. 

A specially bred sub-species of Neguit is the most common creature found in the lands. It is bred for its copious amount of wool that can be harvested in its autumn coat, producing plenty of insulation and thick threads for the winter to come. During the winter, most of the livestock are slaughtered for meat to last through the hard seasons. Only the best of the livestock survive and live inside houses and halls in order to create the next moons line of livestock.

Masonry

Whilst exports are small in quantity, Gorjovak's masonry is renowned for its quality and endurance throughout the Inditt Region.

Ironwork

Gorjovak is also known for its quality metalwork, including weapons, tools, and gates.

Military

Their uniforms are either red or purple tunics. The tunics are thread with a thin metal weave that creates a lightweight armour that can withstand sword and axe. Typical weapons are hammers due to their dual use as a tool, and spears, which are often used for their light weight and ease to carry whist traversing the mountain ranges. They also proficient archers.

Temple

The first recorded Ren-Sumbi was Hakk Muttas, who is recorded only by ancient tapestries in the Gorjon Archives. The Ren-Luzzo of the Gorjon Temple is Barbaska Neet.
preface: Gorjovak is a mountainous region in the North-West of the Inditt Region. It contains many settlements set amongst its mountains. The name Gorjovak refers to both its location and the kingdom under which it is ruled. It is the longest lasting nation in the Inditt Region.

Age of Races

Vant Gorjosofor is the oldest recorded Cazar (King) of Gorjovak. It is believed that either his family name gave the name to the region, or that his family name was inspired by the region. Vant Gorjosofar's eldest son Turu Gorjosofar became Mant Tummo in the Age of the First Men. In the oldest written histories documenting the Gorjosofar family it is said that the Gorjosofar line had already ruled Gorjovak since mankind was born, meaning that their dynasty had already lasted for 2000 moons, although this cannot be proven.

Age of the First Men

When Turu Gorjosofar rose to power, his father Vant Gorjosofar had already died, and Turu was already Cazar. However, he chose to adopt the new title of Mant to signify his greater power. He ordered for the construction of the fortress of Gor'kul, which still stands and has never once been breached in its entire history.

Age of Uncertainty

When Turu died, the contest for rulership began. The name of Gorjovak's next ruler is known only as "Horrum", and is thought to have been Turu's cousin on his Mother's side. Horrum readopted the title of Cazar, wishing not to be associated with the overthrown First Men, and thus the title remained throughout history. During the remainder of the age, Gorjovak stood as one of the few areas of stability due to its isolation. Whilst the Gorjon people have always been self-relient, the chaos of the Inditt Region cemented this mindset.

Geography

Location

Gorjovak is located in the far North-West of the Inditt Region. The kingdom's territory stretches further than the Mountains of Gorjovak, reaching slightly further South and East. At the base of the mountain range is the remainder of the Forest of Kunnbar, now named the Forest of Handunn.

Climate

Due to its elevation, Gorjovak experiences a perpetually colder climate, although winter seasons are especially cold and snow and ice become all-consuming.

Its climate has given rise to many regional variations of common animals, such as the Gorjon Neguit, which grows exceptional thick wool, and also unique fauna and flora. 

Governance

Cazar

A Cazar governs the realm of Gorjovak from within the ancient fortress of Gor'kul. Gorjovak is the only surviving monarchy in the Inditt Region, and it is said (but not confirmed) that the line of the monarchy descends from Mant Tummo. The title of Cazar is usually passed to the Cazar's eldest child upon their death. A Cazar is sworn to serve the realm their entire life, and as such one may never abdicate.

Architecture

Most buildings are made using the plentiful supply of hard mountain stone, with tumber being used from the Forest of Handunn to provide roofing and outhouses. Watchtowers litter the mountain range, as well as a multitude of safe-houses for scouts and travellers alike to find refuge during adverse weather conditions.

There are no cities in Gorjovak. Whilst Gor'kul can house up to 5,000 men, the largest settlement is Dieradorr in the Eastern parts of the range, which has a population of about 30,000.

Notable Locations

  • Gor'kul
  • Dieradoor
  • The Tombs
  • The Three Bridges
  • Forest of Kunnbar

Culture

People

The Gorjan people are a proud culture who tend to be hostile to outside cultural influence. The cooler temperatures gives them paler skin, and so they can find it difficult to acclimatise to warmer sea-level temperatures. They are known for thick brown hair and green eyes.

Clothing              

They wear heavy linen garments, more akin to medieval tunics than the lightweight cloth tunics found in the desert towns, and are typically a deep red or purple in colour.

Economy

Agriculture

The ground of Gorjovak is relatively fertile, for it contains nutritional remainders from the mountain’s volcanic history. However, the cold climate makes agriculture a constant battle. This has led to the hardy nature of the Gorjon people. 

A specially bred sub-species of Neguit is the most common creature found in the lands. It is bred for its copious amount of wool that can be harvested in its autumn coat, producing plenty of insulation and thick threads for the winter to come. During the winter, most of the livestock are slaughtered for meat to last through the hard seasons. Only the best of the livestock survive and live inside houses and halls in order to create the next moons line of livestock.

Masonry

Whilst exports are small in quantity, Gorjovak's masonry is renowned for its quality and endurance throughout the Inditt Region.

Ironwork

Gorjovak is also known for its quality metalwork, including weapons, tools, and gates.

Military

Their uniforms are either red or purple tunics. The tunics are thread with a thin metal weave that creates a lightweight armour that can withstand sword and axe. Typical weapons are hammers due to their dual use as a tool, and spears, which are often used for their light weight and ease to carry whist traversing the mountain ranges. They also proficient archers. At its strongest, the Gorjon army can command up to 4,000 men.

Temple

The first recorded Ren-Sumbi was Hakk Muttas, who is recorded only by ancient tapestries in the Gorjon Archives. The Ren-Luzzo of the Gorjon Temple is Barbaska Neet.
preface: Gorjovak is a mountainous region in the North-West of the Inditt Region. It contains many settlements set amongst its mountains. The name Gorjovak refers to both its location and the kingdom under which it is ruled. It is the longest lasting nation in the Inditt Region.

Its climate has given rise to many regional variations of common animals, such as the Gorjon Neguit, which grows exceptional thick wool, and also unique fauna and flora.

A Cazar governs the realm of Gorjovak from within the ancient fortress of Gor'kul. Gorjovak is the only surviving monarchy in the Inditt Region, and it is said (but not confirmed) that the line of the monarchy descends from Mant Tummo. The title of Cazar is usually passed to the Cazar's eldest child upon their death. A Cazar is sworn to serve the realm their entire life, and as such one may never abdicate.

Most buildings are made using the plentiful supply of hard mountain stone, with tumber being used from the Forest of Handunn to provide roofing and outhouses. There are no cities in Gorjovak. Whilst Gor'kul can house up to 5,000 men, the largest settlement is Dieradorr in the Eastern parts of the range, which has a population of about 30,000.

Notable Locations

  • Gor'kul
  • Dieradoor
  • The Tombs
  • The Three Bridges
  • Forest of Kunnbar

Culture

People

The Gorjan people are a proud culture who tend to be hostile to outside cultural influence. The cooler temperatures gives them paler skin, and so they can find it difficult to acclimatise to warmer sea-level temperatures. They are known for thick brown hair and green eyes.

Clothing              

They wear heavy linen garments, more akin to medieval tunics than the lightweight cloth tunics found in the desert towns, and are typically a deep red or purple in colour.

Economy

Agriculture

The ground of Gorjovak is relatively fertile, for it contains nutritional remainders from the mountain’s volcanic history. However, the cold climate makes agriculture a constant battle. This has led to the hardy nature of the Gorjon people. 

A specially bred sub-species of Neguit is the most common creature found in the lands. Masonry

Whilst exports are small in quantity, Gorjovak's masonry is renowned for its quality and endurance throughout the Inditt Region.

Ironwork

Gorjovak is also known for its quality metalwork, including weapons, tools, and gates.

Military

Gorjovak's majority force is comprised of a company called the Red Cloaks, despite wearing either red or purple clothing. Their tunics are thread with a thin metal weave that creates a lightweight armour that can withstand sword and axe. The Red Cloaks' assigned weapons are swords and bows, with soldiers usually focusing on one or the other, as well as spears which all are expected to carry.

A Heavy Infantry unit called the Gold Cloaks wield war-axes and sport heavier armour.

Gorjovak also keeps an elite infantry unit called the Hammovak, which sport substantial armour and great battle hammers.


At its strongest, the Gorjon army can command up to 4,000 men.

Temple

The first recorded Ren-Sumbi was Hakk Muttas, who is recorded only by ancient tapestries in the Gorjon Archives. The Ren-Luzzo of the Gorjon Temple is Barbaska Neet.
